title: How to Make Lemonade from Lemon Juice Concentrate

steps.headline: Mix a little water into the concentrate to make a thick mixture.
Add maple syrup with a little cayenne.
steps.description: This will make your lemonade unique.

steps.headline: Add sugar to taste.
steps.description: With the maple syrup, it might not be necessary.

steps.headline: Add a little salt (1/4 spoon) in the mixture.
steps.description: If you have black salt, try that.

steps.headline: Fill the glass with cold water and mix.
steps.description: Ice is optional; if the concentrate is still slushy and cold, ice might not be necessary.

steps.headline: Add mint leaves for garnish.
steps.description: For extra mint flavor, bruise the leaves first.

steps.headline: Decorate the glass with cute little umbrellas, and put a straw.
Dice a thin little piece of lemon and put it on the edge of glass.

text: Mix a little water into the concentrate to make a thick mixture.  Add maple syrup with a little cayenne. This will make your lemonade unique. Add sugar to taste. With the maple syrup, it might not be necessary. Add a little salt (1/4 spoon) in the mixture. If you have black salt, try that. Fill the glass with cold water and mix. Ice is optional; if the concentrate is still slushy and cold, ice might not be necessary. Add mint leaves for garnish. For extra mint flavor, bruise the leaves first. Decorate the glass with cute little umbrellas, and put a straw.  Dice a thin little piece of lemon and put it on the edge of glass.
